column5: After a killer day on Saturday, I got a call from a couple buddies asking if I want to go back.  I didnt need much time to make the decision, though I was a little hesitant with the strong east winds pushing in.  We got out around 8:30 and the wind was already bucking out there, but we ran to saturday's location.  After 30 minutes and 6 pike, we realized we needed to do some looking.  the water was 4 degrees warmer than Saturday, so I figured they would be heading towards typical spawning locations.  We made a move and it didnt take long before we were into them.  We didnt get nearly the numbers that we did before, but there were some slabs around and we put about 40 fish in the boat over the next few hours.  No complaints here!  As usual, X-Zone Pan Slammers did the trick, and we got a couple bigger fish on the Shiver Shads as well.    http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1JOzufNCgYU&feature=g-upl
The one on the right on the last picture is an absolute hog! How much did that brute weigh?
Really nice slabs there, Steve...and you have lost a ton of weight!  Lookin' good
don't know the weight, but she was 15.75in which is a definite PB
i am SO jealous... you don't even understand...
I don't see any slabs....just barn doors!  This is a time when I really really miss that part of ont.
Solid fish Steve... as you always catch dood!

HUGE Crappies....HUGE.......nice going.....  BTW they are not spawning "yet" they are on their pre-spawn FEEDING mode when they are bunched up like that....temps in the low to mid 60's is when crappie spawn.
Some TANKS there Steve! Great job! Can't beat any Xzone product, that's for sure!
I just mentioned that they were moving towards their typical locations. Once we got into them it was game on!
